c74object.name: bach.post
c74object.digest: Print lllls in the Max window, element by element
c74object.description: Displays lllls in the Max window, emphasizing their structure.

objarg.name: parameters
objarg.description: If one argument is present, it is considered the name of the object, to be displayed in the "object" column of the Max window. If two arguments are present, they are considered maxdepth and name. If three arguments are present, they are considered mindepth, maxdepth and name.

method.name: llll
method.description: The llll is displayed one element per line, with each element's depth shown. Sublists are entered or not according to the maxdepth attribute. If a line in the Max window is double-clicked, the bach.post object that wrote it is highlighted.

attribute.name: maxdecimals
attribute.description: The maximum number of decimal digits to be displayed for floats. The default is 6.

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.description: maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which sublists are entered and displayed element by element. Sublists deeper than maxdepth are displayed as single elements, on one line. A negative value means that for each branch of the llll the maximum depth is counted from the deepest level of the branch. A value of 0 is treated as a special case where the input llll is printed as a whole, as in the bach.print object. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).

attribute.name: mindepth
attribute.description: The minimum depth of the elements to be printed. Elements less deep than mindepth are skipped. A negative value means that for each branch of the llll the minimum depth is counted from the deepest level of the branch.

c74object.discussion: The llll is displayed one element per line, with each element's depth shown. If a line in the Max window is double-clicked, the bach.post object that wrote it is highlighted.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The llll is displayed one element per line, with each element's depth shown. If a line in the Max window is double-clicked, the bach.post object that wrote it is highlighted.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: post, print, Max window, show, display.
